data.name: AccessibleTextType
desc: Collection of types of text portions.
This collection describes the types of text portions that can be accessed with the help of the methods of the XAccessibleText interface.

items.name: CHARACTER
lines: Indicates that single (multibyte) characters are used.

items.name: WORD
lines: Indicates that single words are used. The definition of what a word is, is implementation and language/locale dependent. While in English a word is ended by a space or a special character like a comma or a period, this is not necessarily true in other languages.

items.name: SENTENCE
lines: Indicates that single sentences are used. The definition of what a sentence is, is implementation and language/locale dependent. While in English a sentence is ended by a period, this is not necessarily true in other languages.

items.name: PARAGRAPH
lines: Indicates that single paragraphs are used. The definition of what a paragraph is, is implementation and language/locale dependent.

items.name: LINE
lines: Indicates that single lines, as displayed on the screen, are used. In contrast to the constants CHARACTER, WORD, SENTENCE, and PARAGRAPH which are content oriented this constant is view oriented. It can be used to retrieve hyphenation information.

items.name: GLYPH
lines: Glyphs are runs of one or more (multibyte) characters which are displayed as one symbol.

items.name: ATTRIBUTE_RUN
lines: Each attribute run is a character run of maximal length where all characters have the same attributes set.
